intro: Seseli tomentosum, commonly known as the woolly seseli, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its small, white flowers appear in umbels, a feature typical of the carrot family. Seseli tomentosum is often found in alpine or subalpine regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
